bftsmart.tom.server

Interface Executable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BatchExecutable, SingleExecutable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CounterServer, DefaultRecoverable, DefaultSingleRecoverable, DurabilityCoordinator, DurableThroughputServer, MapServer, MemoryThroughputServer, StrongBlockchainRecoverable, StrongThroughputServer, WeakBlockchainRecoverable, WeakThroughputServer, YCSBServer 

    public interface Executable
    Executables that implement this interface can received unordered client requests. To support ordered requests, objects that implement this interface must also implement either 'FIFOExecutable', 'BatchExecutable' or 'SingleExecutable'.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] executeUnordered(byte[] command, MessageContext msgCtx)
      Method called to execute a request totally ordered.
      default TOMMessage executeUnordered(int processID, int viewID, boolean isReplyHash, byte[] command, MessageContext msgCtx) 
      default TOMMessage getTOMMessage(int processID, int viewID, byte[] command, MessageContext msgCtx, byte[] result) 
      byte[] takeCheckpointHash(int cid)
      Invoked by the ServiceREplica object to fetch the checkpoint up to a given consensus instance

    • Method Detail

      • executeUnordered

        byte[] executeUnordered(byte[] command,
                        MessageContext msgCtx)
        Method called to execute a request totally ordered. The message context contains some useful information such as the command sender.
        Parameters:
        command - the command issue by the client
        msgCtx - information related with the command
        Returns:
        the reply for the request issued by the client

      • takeCheckpointHash

        byte[] takeCheckpointHash(int cid)
        Invoked by the ServiceREplica object to fetch the checkpoint up to a given consensus instance
        Parameters:
        cid - ID of the consensus instance up to each the checkpoint hash must be associated with
        Returns:
        Checkpoint hash up to the specified consensus instance
